answers.answer: Its my first and scared to death! Glad I'm not the only one.
Well its my 4th my 1st was premature my second was 7lb my 3rd was 6lbs and I'm scared as hell with my 3rd I didn't go to the hospital til I was 9cm wth was I thinking

I am finding myself much more nervous this time around, rather than being afraid of the unknown, I have a fear of the known.  This is my third as well, and I prefer no drugs, but not enough time passed between my second and this one for me to forget, unlike the 5 years between my first and second.  You have even more reason to be worried, just because of your previous experiences.  Just like every pregnancy, every birth is different, and I hope this is a nice smooth one for you.

My grandma said the other day that delivery is easier if babies are closer together. Not sure how true that is but she said if there are many years between that its like having your first again.. her third labor was 45 minutes start to finish and there is only 2 years between my mom and her brother. Hope that holds true for you that are on your second or more.

My grandma said the other day that delivery is easier if babies are closer together. Not sure how true that is but she said if there are many years between that its like having your first again.. her third labor was 45 minutes start to finish and there is only 2 years between my mom and her brother. Hope that holds true for you that are on your second or more.
Thanks ladies! Makes me feel better that I'm not alone in feeling this way.

This is my 3rd pregnancy also. My last 2 pregnancies went perfect. Not one problem...except neither wanted to come out lol. Both came almost at 42 weeks & I had to be induced. Now I am 21 weeks 3 days with the 3rd baby. I have been put as high risk due to problems with the babys heart. :•( but to answer your question...i think I am more nervous about delivery this time around!! I guess b/c I know whats coming!!
Your babies must have really liked their home. lol I hope everything goes perfectly with your new little one's heart. I'm sure that is very stressful for you. =(

I am having a lot of anxiety about giving birth. I am pregnant with twins and will be having a c section when the time comes .. my last two pregnancies my water broke too soon and the babies died at 20 and 24 weeks. I still had to go through labor and delivery and it was very traumatizing to me. So now I am a basket case of anxieties and fears. To the point I am even scared of the labor and delivery floor at the hospital  =(So your not alone!

I'm right with Mikaleen! Mine have been so close together that I haven't forgotten the pain. Mainly because I had back labour. I also didn't have any drugs. I'm just worried about the pain afterwards. I had 20+ stitches (mainly on the inside) from my 9lb 3oz baby boy. I'm hoping this one is small! LOL My recovery was horrible...took me at least 2 weeks to walk right!
I am so sorry to hear that your little ones didn't make it, your anxiety is WAY more justifiable than mine. I hope this pregnancy continues to go smoothly for you and your little ones. =)

20+ stitches! Yikes! You are a trooper for sure and with no drugs. My first son was 10lbs. and I (sorry for TMI) tore all the way to my anus, they called it a 3rd degree laceration, upside for me was that I had an epidural with him and felt that pressure but not so much the tearing or stitching.

question: I know this may sound ridiculous because this is my 3rd baby, but I am actually really nervous about giving birth this time around. I've had vaginal deliveries both times, to a 10lb. & 3lb. 9oz. baby. My oldest was right on time but I had gestational diabetes that wasn't caught until later in my pregnancy but his labor wasn't too bad considering it's still labor. My second son was induced at 31.6 weeks due to me having severe preeclampsia. I think his labor has somewhat traumatized me due to all things that I had to have done within the week I had to stay in the hospital. Am I being silly or does anyone else feel a little nervous about giving birth?
title: Feeling Nervous
